title: Album Page, "Distant View of Loches from Church at Beaulieu", June 21, 1888
medium: Graphite on thick off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, upper right corner (perpendicular to drawing): 57; bottom right corner (perpendicular to drawing): 50; center, below drawing: Distant view of Loches from / church at Beaulieu - June 21st 1888.
description: Horizontal sheet tipped vertically into binding illustrating a distant town seen from a high point.  Visible are a large round tower at left, two large Romanesque towers with steeples to the right of this, and a few larger, lower rectangular structures with turrets a short distance to the right of the center towers.  To the very far right and closer to the foreground is a belltower with domed cupola.  There is a stand of trees in the foreground, and repeated rows of these trees which create a boundary from the foreground and the town in the distance.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Distant View of Loches from Church at Beaulieu", June 21, 1888.Graphite on thick off-white wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-223.
